info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 9:31PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A heavy rain shower with an isolated rumble of thunder will impact portions of northeastern Warren and northwestern Washington Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 928 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm near Huletts Landing, or 10 miles northwest of Whitehall, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Warrensburg, Bolton Landing, Huletts Landing, Mount Hope, Bolton, Shelving Rock, Cleverdale, South Bay, Silver Bay, South Bay Village, Diamond Point, Pilot Knob, Sabbath Day Point, Brayton, Iron Furnace, Riverbank, Rockhurst, North Bolton and Hogtown. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 23 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage and street flooding.
